text:
44yo gentleman with h/o recently discovered pulmonary malignancy
   presenting with dyspnea x 2 days. Presents to ED with dyspnea,
   tachycardia and normal BP. Chest CTA (-) for PE.  ABG wnls.  EKG with
   lateral ST elevation and (+) CK MB and Trop.  Pt taken to Cath Lab and
   admitted to CCU service. In Cath Lab, cath revealing
clean
   coronaries
, PCWP elevated around 20 , pulmonary hypertension ( PA
   60/30) and informal pulmonary arteriogram confirming (-) PE and sent to
   ICU post.
   PMH
   Malignancy with mass in lung and spine--prelim diagnosis is small cell
   ?Cystic mass found in thyroid gland about 6 weeks ago
   CARDIAC RISK FACTORS: No diabetes, dyslipidemia, or hypertension
   CARDIAC HISTORY: none
   CABG: None
   Dyspnea (Shortness of breath)
   Assessment:
   Pt continues with rr 35-40 at rest. States breathing feels a little
   labored with activity but  not bad at rest. Lungs clear and diminished
   at bases. 02 sat in mid to low 90s on 5lnc. + dry cough.
   Action:
   HOB maintained upright. Pt encouraged to take slow deep breaths and to
   pace/limit activity.
   Response:
   No change in breathing pattern.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor resp. status, continue to encourage pt to cough,
   deep breathe, pace/limit activities to conserve energy.
   Tachycardia, Other
   Assessment:
   Pt remains tachycardic with hr in 120s-130s at rest. No ectopy.
   Maintaining adequate bp. U.o., improving from fluid bolus pt received
   at change of shift. Pt had received total of 1.5 liters ns during
   previous day shift when team felt pt was dry.
   Action:
   Pt received the rest of the liter ns bolus. Urine sent for lytes,
   sodium, creatinine, eosinophils.
   Response:
   Hr without significant change, remains tachycardic but u.o. improved.
   Voiding adequate amts clear yellow urine.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor tachycardia. Assess i&o, f/u with urine test
   results.
   Cancer (Malignant Neoplasm), Lung
   Assessment:
   By xray and CT pt has a large lung mass and spinal mass. Still awaiting
   results of biopsy done [**2-19**]. pt had mapping done [**2-20**] for emergent chest
   and spine radiation. Pt received his first dose of radiation [**2-20**] of
   spine but was unable to receive his lung portion d/t pt  becoming
   confused and moving around on radiation table too much. Confusion was
   correlated to being given total of 2mg ativan earlier in shift.
   Action:
   Pt a&ox3 with cueing but still c/o hallucinations seeing things from
   his house and feeling weird from receiving the ativan earlier. Bed
   alarm on, height of bed down, call light within reach. Pt with wife at
   bedside. Wife and pt both very sleep deprived. Wife giving pt  frequent
   emotional support to try to sleep.
   Response:
   Pt continues to be oriented with cueing but still hallucinating.
   Cooperative with care at beginning of shift, but by 3am ripped off his
   telemetry leads refusing to have vitals monitored except for bp. Pt
   oriented with cueing but still with + hallucinations thinking he is
   seeing things at his house even though he states he knows he
s in the
   hospital and as a newly diagnosed lung mass. Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 397**] was notified
   of pt
s noncompliance with wearing telemetry since 3am and refusing 4am
   assessment and am labs. Wife remains with pt at bedside. Pt also had
   earlier pulled out his iv in his left arm. Pt with functioning piv in
   right arm but refusing to have 2^nd iv placed at this time. Wife
   remains at bedside for support.
   Plan:
   Plan is for pt to have 10 days of radiation. The next radiation due [**2-21**]
   in am
? Time.
   Social: social work to continue to follow pt and wife for emotional
   support.
   ------ Protected Section ------
   3am pt refusing to keep cardiac monitor on, refusing 02, refusing
   assessment and refusing am lab draw. Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) **] up to speak with pt
   and pt still refusing this care. Pt willing to stay in bed overnight to
   sleep. At 6am pt willing to wear 02 : cool neb face tent placed on pt
   with 02 sat 98%. Pt still refusing all other care. Continue to monitor
   and attempt to replace monitoring it pt allows as well as assessment
   and am labs.
   ------ Protected Section Addendum Entered By:[**Name (NI) 180**] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) 181**], RN
   on:[**2133-2-21**] 07:48 ------
